result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa S. LaPlaca was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:26 pm - DA calls case and states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Melissa S. LaPlaca appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA moves to amend Ct 1 to simple possession of THC, removing the enhancer.  So ordered.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to all counts.  Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC.  DE to submit DNA sample at PRSO.  Court imposes:

Ct 1 - Sentence withheld - 1 year probation
Conditions of probation
$243 cc
$200 DNAAS
$55 SBDA
Submit to AODA assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommendations at the agents discretion

Ct 2 - Sentence withheld - 1 year probation
Conditions of probation
$243 cc
Submit to AODA assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommendations at the agents discretion

Contraband evidence to be destroyed after appeal time has expired

Appeal rights given
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 8, 2017 at 02:15 pm.

Lex presents court a waiver of preliminary hearing form.  Court questions DE regarding that.  DA files Information, parties acknowlege and waive its reading.    DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 8, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 8, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
